Despite Joe Root and Harry Brook's centuries, India's unwavering belief and Siraj's heroics sealed the unforgettable win.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-mohammed-siraj-seals-thriller-as-india-win-oval-test-by-6-runs-draw-series-2-2/articleshow/123093731.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-mohammed-siraj-seals-thriller-as-india-win-oval-test-by-6-runs-draw-series-2-2/articleshow/123093731.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 16:30:16 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="166606" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123093706,imgsize-166606.cms"/></item><item><title>'I gave him salaam, he slapped me': Flyer roughed up on IndiGo flight shares ordeal</title><description><![CDATA[Hoosain Ahmed Mazumdar, assaulted on an IndiGo flight from Mumbai to Kolkata, returned home after a harrowing 48 hours. His family accuses IndiGo of negligence, citing a lack of communication regarding his whereabouts after the incident. Mazumdar, a gym cleaner, was allegedly attacked by a co-passenger, Hafizur Rahman, mid-flight.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/guwahati/mid-air-slapgate-cachar-youth-returns-home-family-slams-airline-for-negligence/articleshow/123079987.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/guwahati/mid-air-slapgate-cachar-youth-returns-home-family-slams-airline-for-negligence/articleshow/123079987.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 12:10:09 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="22508" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123088648,imgsize-22508.cms"/></item><item><title>'Be very cautious': Kremlin's warning to Trump over 'nuclear rhetoric'</title><description><![CDATA[The Kremlin has urged caution following Donald Trump's announcement of deploying two nuclear submarines closer to Russia. This action was a response to Dmitry Medvedev's provocative statements regarding nuclear capabilities. Trump emphasized the deployment as a precaution, highlighting the US's readiness to protect its people amidst escalating tensions and potential new sanctions against Russia.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/europe/should-be-very-cautious-russia-attentive-to-trumps-nuclear-rhetoric-cites-npt/articleshow/123093193.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/europe/should-be-very-cautious-russia-attentive-to-trumps-nuclear-rhetoric-cites-npt/articleshow/123093193.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 15:37:36 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1557980" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123093481,imgsize-1557980.cms"/></item><item><title>Cong ignores SC rap, doubles down on China claim; takes 'DDLJ' jab at Centre</title><description><![CDATA[The Supreme Court's criticism of Rahul Gandhi's remarks on the India-China border standoff has ignited a political firestorm. The BJP has accused Gandhi of being "anti-national" and undermining national security, citing his comments on Chinese incursions.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/china-claim-row-congress-questions-sc-takes-ddlj-jab-at-centre-bjp-calls-rahul-gandhi-anti-national-galwan/articleshow/123094056.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/china-claim-row-congress-questions-sc-takes-ddlj-jab-at-centre-bjp-calls-rahul-gandhi-anti-national-galwan/articleshow/123094056.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 16:41:29 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1103177" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123094572,imgsize-1103177.cms"/></item><item><title>'Not young, but gun': Shubman Gill reveals Gambhir's fired-up mantra</title><description><![CDATA[Shubman Gill was named India’s ‘Player of the Series’ after scoring 754 runs, which included four centuries. His standout performances included scores of 147 in Leeds, 269 and 161 in Birmingham, and 103 in Manchester.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-not-young-but-gun-shubman-gill-reveals-gautam-gambhirs-fired-up-mantra/articleshow/123096968.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-not-young-but-gun-shubman-gill-reveals-gautam-gambhirs-fired-up-mantra/articleshow/123096968.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 18:23:39 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SAHIL MALHOTRA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="55962" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123096995,imgsize-55962.cms"/></item><item><title>Google CEO Sundar Pichai to employees: ‘I think we have to....'</title><description><![CDATA[Google's CEO Sundar Pichai and executives like Brian Saluzzo are urging employees to accelerate the integration of AI into their workflows, aiming for increased productivity and efficiency. This push includes internal AI tools like Cider and training programs developed with DeepMind, such as "Building with Gemini," to enhance software engineers' capabilities.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/google-ceo-sundar-pichai-to-employees-i-think-we-have-to-accomplish-more/articleshow/123051998.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/google-ceo-sundar-pichai-to-employees-i-think-we-have-to-accomplish-more/articleshow/123051998.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 08:20:38 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="18668" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123052356,imgsize-18668.cms"/></item><item><title>Delhi moves to regulate private school fees; Sood slams 'mafias', says education isn't for sale</title><description><![CDATA[Delhi government proposes a bill to control private school fees. The move follows protests over fee hikes. Many schools increased fees significantly, burdening parents. The bill seeks to ensure transparency and prevent commercialization. It includes penalties for schools violating regulations. It also establishes a grievance system for parents. The bill aims to balance regulation and school autonomy.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/education/news/delhi-education-minister-ashish-sood-introduces-bill-to-regulate-private-school-fees-curb-commercialisation/articleshow/123096804.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/education/news/delhi-education-minister-ashish-sood-introduces-bill-to-regulate-private-school-fees-curb-commercialisation/articleshow/123096804.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 18:12:18 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>LAKSHIMA SAREEN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="10208" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123096788,imgsize-10208.cms"/></item><item><title>IND vs ENG: 'Breakup ke baad bhi dukh hota hai' - Siraj opens up after topsy-turvy series</title><description><![CDATA[Mohammed Siraj's exceptional performance, highlighted by a crucial final-day spell, secured India's thrilling six-run victory against England, leveling the series 2-2. HIs decisive dismissal of Gus Atkinson with a searing yorker, showcased his resilience and determination. Despite earlier setbacks, Siraj's unwavering belief and fiery spirit propelled India to a memorable win at The Oval.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-test-breakup-ke-baad-bhi-dukh-hota-hai-mohammed-siraj-opens-up-after-topsy-turvy-series/articleshow/123096380.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-test-breakup-ke-baad-bhi-dukh-hota-hai-mohammed-siraj-opens-up-after-topsy-turvy-series/articleshow/123096380.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 18:35:51 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SAHIL MALHOTRA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="98394" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123097104,imgsize-98394.cms"/></item><item><title>Watch: Gavaskar celebrates Siraj's winning moment in Oval comm box</title><description><![CDATA[Mohammed Siraj's decisive yorker secured a thrilling six-run victory for India in the Oval Test, sparking celebrations both on and off the field. Sunil Gavaskar's enthusiastic applause in the commentary box highlighted the significance of the win. India's bowlers, spearheaded by Siraj, orchestrated a remarkable comeback, denying England a series victory and igniting pride among fans and legends alike.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-sunil-gavaskar-celebrates-mohammed-sirajs-winning-moment-in-oval-commentary-box-watch/articleshow/123096941.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-sunil-gavaskar-celebrates-mohammed-sirajs-winning-moment-in-oval-commentary-box-watch/articleshow/123096941.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 18:29:24 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="117826" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123096972,imgsize-117826.cms"/></item><item><title>US startup lists 70-hour weeks; echoes China’s 996 work culture in Silicon Valley</title><description><![CDATA[Silicon Valley AI startups are increasingly adopting China's controversial "996" work schedule, pushing employees to work extreme hours despite its outlaw status in China. Fueled by the global AI race and the ambition to build billion-dollar companies, this trend raises concerns about labor law compliance and worker exploitation, even as some Gen Z workers embrace the demanding culture.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/dont-bother-to-apply-unless-excited-about-working-70-hours-a-week-says-job-listings-of-american-startup-how-chinas-996-working-culture-may-be-spilling-to-silicon-valley/articleshow/123093906.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/dont-bother-to-apply-unless-excited-about-working-70-hours-a-week-says-job-listings-of-american-startup-how-chinas-996-working-culture-may-be-spilling-to-silicon-valley/articleshow/123093906.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 16:34:26 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="20960" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123094235,imgsize-20960.cms"/></item><item><title>TMC rift widens: Kalyan Banerjee quits as chief whip; slams Mahua Moitra</title><description><![CDATA[Kalyan Banerjee resigned as TMC's chief whip in Lok Sabha. This follows a public dispute with party MP Mahua Moitra. Banerjee criticized Moitra's comments made during a podcast. He deemed her language dehumanizing and uncivil. Banerjee defended his questions about public figures' conduct. He accused Moitra of personal attacks to deflect from her performance.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/tmc-feud-escalates-kalyan-banerjee-quits-as-chief-whip-slams-mahua-moitras-abusive-remarks/articleshow/123096836.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/tmc-feud-escalates-kalyan-banerjee-quits-as-chief-whip-slams-mahua-moitras-abusive-remarks/articleshow/123096836.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 18:17:55 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1035338" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123096888,imgsize-1035338.cms"/></item><item><title>‘What was the tearing hurry?’: SC questions UP govt on Banke Bihari ordinance</title><description><![CDATA[The Supreme Court has questioned the Uttar Pradesh government's decision to take over the Shri Banke Bihari temple management in Vrindavan, citing a lack of consultation with key stakeholders before the corridor project order on May 15. The court expressed concern over the state's urgency in enacting the ordinance and its approach to the court without informing involved parties.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/what-was-the-tearing-hurry-sc-questions-up-govt-on-banke-bihari-ordinance-may-put-corridor-nod-on-hold/articleshow/123095831.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/what-was-the-tearing-hurry-sc-questions-up-govt-on-banke-bihari-ordinance-may-put-corridor-nod-on-hold/articleshow/123095831.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 17:40:14 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="117162" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123095853,imgsize-117162.cms"/></item><item><title>'I will change the game': Siraj's promise to himself before Day 5 heroics</title><description><![CDATA[Mohammed Siraj's stellar bowling helped India defeat England in a thrilling Test match at The Oval. India leveled the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series 2-2 with a narrow six-run victory. Siraj took five wickets, including a crucial three-wicket haul on the final day. His efforts secured India's narrowest Test win. Siraj finished as the series' highest wicket-taker with 23 wickets. ]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-i-will-change-the-game-mohammed-sirajs-promise-to-himself-before-day-5-heroics/articleshow/123096099.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-i-will-change-the-game-mohammed-sirajs-promise-to-himself-before-day-5-heroics/articleshow/123096099.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 17:49:50 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="42068" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123096100,imgsize-42068.cms"/></item><item><title>Apple CEO Tim Cook confirms: Majority of new iPhones sold in US 'made' in India</title><description><![CDATA[Apple CEO Tim Cook stated that most iPhones sold in the US during the last quarter were made in India, despite Donald Trump's criticism of this manufacturing shift. India has become the main hub for iPhone production for the US market, while China focuses on non-US regions. Apple is experiencing record revenue growth in India, driven by strong iPhone sales.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/apple-ceo-tim-cook-confirms-majority-of-new-iphones-sold-in-the-us-are-made-in-india-while-vietnam-is-the-location-for-/articleshow/123071759.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/apple-ceo-tim-cook-confirms-majority-of-new-iphones-sold-in-the-us-are-made-in-india-while-vietnam-is-the-location-for-/articleshow/123071759.cms</guid><pubDate>Sun, 03 Aug 2025 09:51:57 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="36252" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123071756,imgsize-36252.cms"/></item><item><title>IND vs ENG: 'When Siraj took that final wicket...': Brendon McCullum on India's hero</title><description><![CDATA[Brendon McCullum lauded Mohammed Siraj's match-winning performance in the fifth Test, acknowledging his fighting spirit. He described the series as an enthralling contest, highlighting the intense physical and mental demands on both teams. McCullum felt a 2-2 draw was a fair result, praising the players' resilience throughout the grueling five-match series, which he considered an 'unbelievable spectacle'.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/when-siraj-took-that-final-wicket-as-much-i-was-disappointed-england-coach-brendon-mccullum-on-indias-hero/articleshow/123096883.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/when-siraj-took-that-final-wicket-as-much-i-was-disappointed-england-coach-brendon-mccullum-on-indias-hero/articleshow/123096883.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 18:22:42 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="93154" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123096939,imgsize-93154.cms"/></item><item><title>Abhishek Banerjee named TMC leader in Lok Sabha</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/abhishek-banerjee-named-tmc-leader-in-lok-sabha-replaces-ailing-sudip-bandopadhyay-decision-taken-in-virtual-meet-led-by-mamata-banerjee/articleshow/123095990.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/abhishek-banerjee-named-tmc-leader-in-lok-sabha-replaces-ailing-sudip-bandopadhyay-decision-taken-in-virtual-meet-led-by-mamata-banerjee/articleshow/123095990.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 17:41:58 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="22736" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123095974,imgsize-22736.cms"/></item><item><title>Foxconn sells Lordstown plant for $88 million but keeps EV production running</title><description><![CDATA[Foxconn has finalized the sale of its Lordstown, Ohio, factory to Crescent Dune LLC for $88 million, while maintaining operations as a tenant. This move allows Foxconn to reinvest in US-based initiatives, focusing on electric vehicle production and advanced manufacturing. The sale reflects Foxconn's strategy to optimize assets and support growth in key sectors.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/international-business/foxconn-sells-lordstown-plant-for-88-million-but-keeps-ev-production-running-while-expanding-us-growth-plans/articleshow/123094141.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/international-business/foxconn-sells-lordstown-plant-for-88-million-but-keeps-ev-production-running-while-expanding-us-growth-plans/articleshow/123094141.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 17:00:43 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TIMESOFINDIA.COM</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="44210" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123094819,imgsize-44210.cms"/></item><item><title>'I downloaded belief' – Siraj reveals photo that inspired Oval heroics |Watch</title><description><![CDATA[Mohammed Siraj's inspired bowling performance led India to a thrilling 6-run victory over England at The Oval, drawing the series 2-2. Siraj, fueled by a 'believe' image and memories of his father, took key wickets, including Jamie Smith and Gus Atkinson.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-i-downloaded-belief-mohammed-siraj-reveals-photo-that-inspired-oval-heroics-watch/articleshow/123095048.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-i-downloaded-belief-mohammed-siraj-reveals-photo-that-inspired-oval-heroics-watch/articleshow/123095048.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 17:04:49 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="98068" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123095032,imgsize-98068.cms"/></item><item><title>That flutter in your chest? It’s an ectopic heartbeat—know this</title><description><![CDATA[Ectopic heartbeats, those occasional skipped or extra beats, are usually harmless and often triggered by caffeine, stress, or exercise. While unsettling, they rarely indicate a serious heart problem, especially in healthy individuals. However, if accompanied by chest pain, fainting, or shortness of breath, consulting a doctor is recommended to rule out underlying issues. ]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/life-style/health-fitness/health-news/whats-that-sudden-flutter-in-your-chest-thats-an-ectopic-heartbeat-heres-what-to-know/articleshow/123084514.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/life-style/health-fitness/health-news/whats-that-sudden-flutter-in-your-chest-thats-an-ectopic-heartbeat-heres-what-to-know/articleshow/123084514.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 07:27:40 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI LIFESTYLE DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="512540" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123084504,imgsize-512540.cms"/></item><item><title>'Nothing goes to waste': Zoo asks people to donate their pets to feed its predators</title><description><![CDATA[Aalborg Zoo in Denmark is now accepting unwanted small pets as donations to feed its predators. The zoo assures that donated animals like rabbits and guinea pigs will be humanely euthanized before being used as food. This initiative aims to mimic the natural food chain, promoting animal welfare and natural behaviour among captive carnivores.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/europe/nothing-goes-to-waste-denmark-zoo-asks-people-to-donate-their-pets-to-feed-its-predators-assures-animals-will-be-gently-euthanized/articleshow/123094679.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/europe/nothing-goes-to-waste-denmark-zoo-asks-people-to-donate-their-pets-to-feed-its-predators-assures-animals-will-be-gently-euthanized/articleshow/123094679.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 17:16:58 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="69438" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123095597,imgsize-69438.cms"/></item><item><title>IND vs ENG: Sachin Tendulkar gives his verdict on Test series - 10/10</title><description><![CDATA[Sachin Tendulkar lauded India's thrilling victory over England in the fifth Test at The Oval, leveling the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's decisive yorker sealed the win after a tense final day. Shubman Gill highlighted the team's determination to shed the 'young team' label.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-sachin-tendulkar-gives-his-verdict-on-test-series-10/10/articleshow/123096256.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-sachin-tendulkar-gives-his-verdict-on-test-series-10/10/articleshow/123096256.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 17:57:02 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="179268" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123096275,imgsize-179268.cms"/></item><item><title>Russian oil: Crude continues to flow into India; no impact of Trump, EU pressure</title><description><![CDATA[Despite pressure from the US and EU, India continues importing Russian crude oil, with multiple tankers offloading millions of barrels at Indian refineries. ' - Nasser Hussain warns England ahead of letting Chris Woakes bat</title><description><![CDATA[The Test series heads into its final morning with England at 339/6, needing 35 runs to win. India requires four wickets to level the series. Chris Woakes' shoulder injury gives India the opportunity to exploit it if he is needed to come and bat. Joe Root and Harry Brook scored centuries for England. Prasidh Krishna took three wickets for India.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-hope-it-doesnt-come-down-to-him-nasser-hussain-warns-england-ahead-of-letting-chris-woakes-bat/articleshow/123092343.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-hope-it-doesnt-come-down-to-him-nasser-hussain-warns-england-ahead-of-letting-chris-woakes-bat/articleshow/123092343.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 15:19:33 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="87114" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123092530,imgsize-87114.cms"/></item><item><title>Guns, gangs & minors: ‘Lady Don’ Zikra chargesheeted in Seelampur teen murder case</title><description><![CDATA[Delhi Police have filed a chargesheet against Zikra, infamously known as 'Lady Don,' and seven others concerning the murder of a 17-year-old boy in Seelampur. The charges include murder and criminal conspiracy. Zikra, associated with the Mastan gang, allegedly groomed teenagers for criminal activities.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/delhi/guns-gangs-minors-lady-don-zikra-chargesheeted-in-seelampur-teen-murder-case/articleshow/123088552.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/delhi/guns-gangs-minors-lady-don-zikra-chargesheeted-in-seelampur-teen-murder-case/articleshow/123088552.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 11:58:27 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI CITY DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="781380" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123088584,imgsize-781380.cms"/></item><item><title>'It will be dramatic, but ... ' - Michael Vaughan's bold prediction ahead of series finale</title><description><![CDATA[Michael Vaughan predicts a dramatic finish to the England-India Test series as England needs 35 runs with limited wickets. Harry Brook's century and Root's ton put England in a strong position, but a late Indian fightback has kept the match alive. The final day promises high tension with India looking to level the series.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-it-will-be-dramatic-but-michael-vaughans-bold-prediction-ahead-of-thrilling-series-finale/articleshow/123092098.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-it-will-be-dramatic-but-michael-vaughans-bold-prediction-ahead-of-thrilling-series-finale/articleshow/123092098.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 14:54:05 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="101788" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123092050,imgsize-101788.cms"/></item><item><title>'Past mistakes ... ': Ex-India cricketer on IND vs ENG Day 4 pressure battle</title><description><![CDATA[Former India batting coach Sanjay Bangar highlighted the intense pressure India exerted on England's batters during the final session of Day 4 in the fifth Test. Despite centuries from Root and Brook, India's seamers triggered a late collapse, leaving England at 339/6, needing 35 more runs.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/past-mistakes-ex-india-cricketer-on-day-4-pressure-battle-in-india-vs-england-test/articleshow/123091738.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/past-mistakes-ex-india-cricketer-on-day-4-pressure-battle-in-india-vs-england-test/articleshow/123091738.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 14:31:02 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="103856" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123091796,imgsize-103856.cms"/></item></channel></rss>

      <description><![CDATA[In its complaint, ADIF alleged that Google, through its multiple group entities, has engaged in anti-competitive conduct by self-preferencing its own services in the AdTech ecosystem, including tying and bundling of its publisher ad server (DFP) with its ad exchange (AdX), and linking access to YouTube ad inventory with the use of its demand-side platform (DV360).]]></description>

      <description><![CDATA[The Genius Act marks a turning point for stablecoins, offering them legal legitimacy and regulatory clarity. “This legitimisation of stablecoins is certainly going to give a huge boost,” says Eswar Prasad, Professor at Cornell University.       <description><![CDATA[SuperK plans to use its ₹100 crore Series B funding to deepen its presence in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Karnataka, rather than expanding nationwide. “We’re not trying to expand everywhere… the market we’re operating in already has immense depth,” said Neeraj Menta, Co-Founder of SuperK.     <item>
      <title><![CDATA[No interim US-India trade deal yet; Indian exporters brace for 20-25% tariffs as August 1 deadline nears]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/world/india-us-trade-deal-delay-trump-tariffs-impact-exporters-19644819.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Indian exporters are gearing up for possible US tariffs of 20–25% as the August 1 deadline set by President Trump approaches without an interim trade deal. While the tariff uncertainty has stalled orders, industry leaders say Indian exporters remain competitively placed compared to rivals like Bangladesh and China. Exporters expect the tariffs to impact profit margins more than supply chains, with fresh orders likely once clarity emerges post-deadline. Trade talks are set to resume in August as both countries work toward a broader agreement.]]></description>
      <pubDate><![CDATA[Mon, 28 Jul 2025 23:11:22 +0530]]></pubDate>

    </item>
